thread.title: Robot can detect signs of depression in your face
thread.title_full: Robot can detect signs of depression in your face

title: Robot can detect signs of depression in your face
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Robot can detect signs of depression in your face The MultiSense technology can categorise human expressions Jim Cornfield/Corbis The MultiSense technology can categorise human expressions Jim Cornfield/Corbis Oliver Moody Science Correspondent Published at 12:01AM, October 23 2015 
Machines may be usurping jobs in a vast range of trades from driving to law, but you can’t beat a human when it comes to reading other people’s expressions, right? 
Possibly wrong. A video camera and a sophisticated algorithm may soon be able to track the symptoms of depression. Robotics researchers at Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, have used the system to work out how the condition plays out on people’s faces. 
The technology, known as MultiSense and based on a sensor designed for robots to “see” the world around them, can categorise expressions by looking at 68 facial markers, including Subscribe now
